verses.kjv: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry.
verses.web: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was angry.
verses.ct: This made Jonah furious. He was deeply upset about it.

verses.kjv: And he prayed unto the LORD, and said, I pray thee, O LORD, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish: for I knew that thou art a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of the evil.
verses.web: He prayed to LORD, and said, “Please, LORD, wasn’t this what I said when I was still in my own country? Therefore I hurried to flee to Tarshish, for I knew that you are a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, and you relent of doing harm.
verses.ct: He prayed to the LORD and said, "LORD, isn't this exactly what I said would happen when I was still back home? That's why I ran away to Tarshish in the first place — because I knew you are a gracious God, full of mercy, slow to anger, overflowing with kindness, and willing to relent from sending disaster.

verses.kjv: Therefore now, O LORD, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.
verses.web: Therefore now, LORD, take, I beg you, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.”
verses.ct: So now, LORD, just take my life. I'd rather die than go on living."

verses.kjv: Then said the LORD, Doest thou well to be angry?
verses.web: LORD said, “Is it right for you to be angry?”
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "Do you have any right to be this angry?"

verses.kjv: So Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there made him a booth, and sat under it in the shadow, till he might see what would become of the city.
verses.web: Then Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there made himself a booth, and sat under it in the shade, until he might see what would become of the city.
verses.ct: Jonah left the city and sat down on its east side. He built himself a small shelter and sat in its shade, waiting to see what would happen to Nineveh.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God prepared a gourd, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shadow over his head, to deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad of the gourd.
verses.web: LORD God prepared a vine, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shade over his head, to deliver him from his discomfort. So Jonah was exceedingly glad because of the vine.
verses.ct: Then the LORD God made a vine grow up over Jonah to shade his head and ease his misery. Jonah was thrilled about the vine.

verses.kjv: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd that it withered.
verses.web: But God prepared a worm at dawn the next day, and it chewed on the vine, so that it withered.
verses.ct: But at dawn the next day, God sent a worm that attacked the vine, and it shriveled up.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said, It is better for me to die than to live.
verses.web: When the sun arose, God prepared a sultry east wind; and the sun beat on Jonah’s head, so that he fainted, and requested for himself that he might die, and said, “It is better for me to die than to live.”
verses.ct: When the sun came up, God sent a scorching east wind. The sun blazed down on Jonah's head until he grew faint. He wished he were dead and said, "I'd rather die than go on living."

verses.kjv: And God said to Jonah, Doest thou well to be angry for the gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry, even unto death.
verses.web: God said to Jonah, “Is it right for you to be angry about the vine?” He said, “I am right to be angry, even to death.”
verses.ct: God asked Jonah, "Do you have any right to be angry about the vine?" Jonah shot back, "I have every right to be angry — angry enough to die!"

verses.kjv: Then said the LORD, Thou hast had pity on the gourd, for the which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night:
verses.web: LORD said, “You have been concerned for the vine, for which you have not labored, neither made it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said, "You're upset about a vine that you didn't plant or tend. It sprang up in a single night and died the next.

verses.kjv: And should not I spare Nineveh, that great city, wherein are more than sixscore thousand persons that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much cattle?
verses.web: Shouldn’t I be concerned for Nineveh, that great city, in which are more than one hundred twenty thousand persons who can’t discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much livestock?”
verses.ct: So shouldn't I care about Nineveh, that enormous city? There are more than 120,000 people in it who don't even know their right hand from their left — not to mention all the livestock."
